dt: {bc}that performs or tends toward an (indicated) action

shortdef: that performs or tends toward an (indicated) action

dt: used to say that one suddenly remembers, understands, or has found something

dt.t: Now, what was his name? Tony? Tom? No, {it}I've got it{/it}! Tim. His name was Tim.

shortdef: —used to say that one suddenly remembers, understands, or has found something—usually I've got it

stems: i've had it up to here

dt: used to show that one has too much of something to deal with or that one is very annoyed by something and will not accept any more of it

dt.t: I have work {it}up to here{/it} and don't have time for this now.
{phrase}I've had it up to here{/phrase} with your nonsense!

shortdef: —used to show that one has too much of something to deal with or that one is very annoyed by something and will not accept any more of it
